intro: Chrozophora mujunkumi, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flower heads and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it both ornamental and useful for attracting pollinators.
